description:
Unable to hear, speak, or wield a sword, Prince Bojji doesn’t seem like a typical heir to the throne—and his kingdom agrees. But his fateful encounter with Kage, a shadow on the ground, gives him his first true friend. The two set off on a grand adventure and, together, form a bond that can overcome any obstacle...even being king.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: อันดับพระราชา

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Amputation
tags.description: Features amputation or amputees.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

_Note: Not to be confused with the mangaka Shin Ogasawara._
Older brother of [Tsutomu Ooshiro](https://anilist.co/staff/154775/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).
Started off as an animator at [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) in the late '80s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Website](http://kinggnu.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kinggnu_jp)

King Gnu is a japanese band formed in 2015. The band was originally called Srv.Vinci, but renamed to King Gnu in 2017. They made their major debut in 2019 under Ariola Japan with the album "Sympa."

**Members:**
- [Daiki Tsuneta](https://anilist.co/staff/158731) (Vo., Gt.)
- Yuu Seki (Dr., Sampler)
- [Kazuki Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/183237) (Ba., Bass synthetizer)
- Satoru Iguchi (Vo., Keyboard)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/douhwe) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ya.ma_00/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClbieOB_NYcY9TlIthmyw-A) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yama_official_tiktok)__

__Introduction:__
yama is a Japanese vocalist affiliated with the record label MASTERSIX FOUNDATION (2020–). They have been active since 2018, but didn't make their debut before November 2019, where they appeared as a guest vocalist on the song "[Nemuru Machi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ePBjUMEeqBw)", produced by vocaloid producer [Kujira](https://twitter.com/WhaleDontSleep).

__Biography:__
After their initial debut, yama wouldn't reappear before later on April 17, 2020, where they released their first original song titled "[Haru wo Tsugeru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DC6JppqHkaM)". Later in the same year on October 21, they made their major debut with the song "[Masshiro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lj64XpVS7dk)" through the record label MASTERSIX FOUNDATION.

Close to the end of 2020, on December 18, yama made their first physical appearance on the channel 'THE FIRST TAKE', performing their song Haru wo Tsugeru.

At the beginning of 2021, yama made their first appearance in anime with the song "[Mahi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2By3feOVw20)", which was used as the opening theme song to the anime 2.43: Seiin High School Boys Volleyball Team. The song is their first CD single, which released on February 10, 2021.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).
